title: Analyzing Ecological Networks
text:
Welcome
The objective of this five-day course, co-organized by the FRB-CESAB and the ANR ECONET, is to train young researchers in analyzing ecological network data. The course covers a general introduction to networks, classical metrics (including modularity, nesteness, clustering), null models, generative models (including SBM), multilayer networks, as well as an overview of newer techniques (such as embedding). Each topic is explored through lectures followed by practicals.

title: Analyzing Ecological Networks
text:
Program
Classes will run from 9am to 5:30pm every day except Friday, when we finish at 4pm.







Monday

Introduction (Graphs, what’s a network?)



Tuesday

Advanced metrics and null models



Wednesday

Stochastic Block Models



Thursday

Multilayer networks



Friday

Subgroups projects

title: Analyzing Ecological Networks
text:
Prerequisites
  Please follow this tutorial to install your working environment before attending the training course. Only R, RStudio Desktop, and Rtools (for Windows users) are required.

title: Analyzing Ecological Networks
text:
Material
All the material used in this training course (slides, data, exercises) is available at: https://github.com/econetoolbox/

title: Setting up R
text: The guide to correctly install and configure a working environment for data science with , , and  is available at: https://frbcesab.github.io/rsetup/

title: R packages to install
text:
Here is a list of packages that you need to install so that you can follow the practicals. You can use install.packages(name-package).

For day 2
library(bipartite)
library(igraph)
library(FWebs)
library(vegan)
library(cheddar)
library(matlib)
library(sbm)
library(alluvial)
library(econetwork)
library(poweRlaw)
Mac users won’t be able to install the package FWebs. They can use this file with the needed functions.
In the course script, there is also an alternative to get the database of all food webs that are in this package, but it requires to have rmangal installed:
library(rmangal)
mg1 <- create.fw.list(db=“mg”, ref=TRUE, spatial = TRUE)


For day 3 and 4
remotes::install_github(“Jo-Theo/shinySbm”)
remotes::install_github(“Chabert-Liddell/colSBM”)
library(colSBM)
library(network)
library(GGally)
library(RColorBrewer)
library(knitr)
